poem:
The Seed of Patience

In soil of solemn faces,  
quiet roots stretch deep—  
a steady, unseen labor.

No bloom to tout at dusk;  
yet, beneath an anxious sun,  
the seeds wait—

for ripen comes  
in time's own measure,  
a whispered promise  
growth will heed,  
beyond the restless clamor  
of the hour.
